item.title: Seattle Ultrasonics
item.description: Discover Seattle Ultrasonics, a startup founded by culinary technologist Scott Heimendinger. We're on a mission to make happy home cooks, and we're starting by building a better knife.

item.title: Vibe Coding Is Creating Braindead Coders
item.description: Confession: Iâ€™ve been using Claude Code to write all my code for me. And I think itâ€™s making me worse at the thing Iâ€™ve loved doing for twelve years. I can clearly see how AI coding is rewiring our brains â€“ it makes developers crave instant gratification instead of deep understanding, and reduces us to gamblers who pull levers for the next hit of working code. If this is happening to me, someone who learned to code in the pre-AI era, whatâ€™s it doing to junior developers whoâ€™ve never known anything else?

item.title: The $100,000 H-1B Fee That Just Made U.S. Developers Competitive Again
item.description: Trump imposes a $100K annual fee on H-1B visas, a move that makes U.S. developers cheaper to hire than foreign workers for the first time in decades.

item.title: kkrieger: Making an Impossible FPS | Nostalgia Nerd
item.description:
Head to â€‹https://www.squarespace.com/nostalgianerd to save 10% off your first purchase of a website or domain using code NOSTALGIANERD.... The 90s and 00s demoscene was filled with incredible sights & sounds for the senses, but none more incredible (in my opinion) than kkrieger; a playable 3D FPS that compacts into just 96KB created by German demo group Farbrausch (theprodukkt). I'm fascinated by this, so it was amazing to get the chance to speak to some of the developers and designers of this monumental release and find out just how and why it was made. #fps #demoscene #kkrieger
Massive thanks to the demoscene legends; giZMo and ryg for their help & resources on this video. giZMo: https://twitter.com/chris_muetze ryg: https://twitter.com/rygorous
00:00 The demoscene 04:17 Farbrausch pre-kkrieger 07:27 Procedural texture generation 10:04 Integrated ad 10:51 Using external libraries 12:19 Bump maps and meshes 13:30 Tools of the trade (Werkkzeug) 14:36 Character modelling 16:34 Reducing the code size 20:31 Detail work 23:03 Compression 24:38 Gameplay 25:26 kkrieger final 26:47 TheProdukkt is no more 28:01 Credits
ğŸ”—Video LinksğŸ”— BreakPoint 04 Site: https://breakpoint.untergrund.net/2004/general.php .theprodukkt: https://web.archive.org/web/20040810211758/http://www.theprodukkt.com/theprodukkt.html#tech The Farbrausch way: https://llg.cubic.org/docs/farbrauschDemos/ Research Gate: https://www.researchgate.net/figure/The-game-kkrieger-has-a-file-size-of-96-kb_fig1_320722498 Breakpoint 2004: https://breakpoint.untergrund.net/2004/ Assembly seminars '04: https://web.archive.org/web/20041204090344/http://www.assembly.org/ fiver2's website: http://www.theunitedstatesofamerica.de/ ryg's homepage: http://www.farbrausch.com/~fg/ gizmo's website: http://www.pixelz.de/ "Metaprogramming for madmen": https://fgiesen.wordpress.com/2012/04/08/metaprogramming-for-madmen/ kkrieger interview from 2004: https://www.gamasutra.com/view/feature/130690/interview_frugal_fragging_with_.php Interview from 2005: https://www.gamasutra.com/view/feature/130690/interview_frugal_fragging_with_.php Github code: https://github.com/farbrausch/fr_public/blob/master/werkkzeug3/genmesh.cpp

item.title: Bezier Curve as Easing Function In C++
Triple Buffering in Rendering APIs
item.description: A practical guide to triple buffering, how it improves smoothness and throughput over double buffering, when to use it, and how to wire it up in modern APIs.

item.title: Less is safer: how Obsidian reduces the risk of supply chain attacks
item.description: Supply chain attacks are malicious updates that sneak into open source code used by many apps. Hereâ€™s how we design Obsidian to ensure that the app is a secure and private environment for your thoughts.

item.title: Dev Culture Is Dying The Curious Developer Is Gone
item.description: From tinkerers to metric seekers: How the shift in developer culture is impacting innovation and creativity.
